captions.text:
Iron Man 3.
Yeah what about it?

It is awesome.
Yeah?

Yeah.
Wait, that movie's not even out yet.

Yeah it is. It�s out today.
No. I mean, �today� in the sense that

we're launching this video �today,� yes�
it comes out �today.� But the day we're

filming it �today,� it's not out yet.
It is in Europe.

Man, I think I would know it if you had gone
to Europe to see Iron Man 3.

Why?
Because I would have noticed your absence,

and it would have been glorious.
Not if I did it sneakily. Covertly.

Covertly?
You know like in shifts.

You flew to Europe in shifts?
I'm not saying I did, no, I�m just offering

that as one possible explanation for how I
could've gotten to Europe to see Iron Man

3 without you noticing.
There are other possible explanations? How

many different possibilities are there? How
many different ways could you have gotten

to Europe.
Well sure. I could have teleported over like

those guys in Jumper.
Oh, see, now I don't know why I didn�t think

of that.
I could have used a Star Trek transporter.

Right, because those are real.
I could have used Gandalf's personal eagle

taxi service.
Man you need to let the eagle thing die, don�t

you think?
Maybe I'm a ninja.

Honestly, the 13-hour flight to Europe done
in shifts over multiple evenings is actually

starting to sound plausible.
Whatever, dude. Regardless, the point is I've

seen Iron Man 3, and you haven't, and it's
awesome.

Prove it.
Prove that I've seen it?

Yeah.
Man, if I say you anything proof-worthy, I'm

gonna be spoiling the movie's plot for all
our nice viewers.

Don't kid yourself, man. Not that many people
watch these things. Not the conversation videos.

Well, at least the people that are watching
them seem to be enjoying them.

Dude, they're just humoring you. They�re
being nice to you because they think you're

mentally challenged.
You're mentally challenged.

You can't use that as an insult, man, that's
basically the same thing as calling me retarded.

No, no, it's the opposite of that. The phrase
�mentally challenged� was created so that

I could call you slow without any of the shame
that comes from having used the word retarded.

Wow.
Dude, wait a minute. I saw your sins videos

for Iron Man 1 and 2. Why would you even see
number 3? I thought you hated the first two.

What's up with that? Why would you even go--
Just because I do a sins video about a movie

doesn't mean I hate it.
What?!

Man, I thought you got this by now. A sins
video isn't a record of a movie's quality

overall, it's just a freaking list of sins.
What? But some of the things you say are just

jokes!
I'm sorry, man, I must have missed the part

where you got to determine the rules for how
I define sins.

So a sin is anything that you find wrong in
a movie, or any dickhead observational jokes

you want to make?
I do not endorse that definition of cinema

sins. No.
Why am I not surprised?

No. In fact, the definition of a cinema sin
is a closely guarded secret. You know how

there's only three people in the world that
know the original recipe for Colonel Sanders

chicken?
Okay, yeah?

Those are the three people I would tell what
the definition of a sin is. Because they know

how to keep a f*cking secret.
I couldn't have done that if I�d tried.

Why does it have to be a secret?
Why does it have to be public? Can't you just

watch a video that pokes fun at a movie without
acting like I violated one of your Constitutional

rights?
You did violate my Constitutional right. My

right not to be confronted by Internet assholes
shoving their opinion in my face.

Right. right. Because YouTube videos are so
obtrusive and invasive.

Dude, can you at least tell me why you bleep
the swear words?
F*ck you.

title: Iron Man 3 - Conversations With Myself About Movies
